TRUTH-SEEKING.text: “But seek first the kingdom of God and His righteousness, and all these things will be given to you as well.”
“Set your minds on things above, not on earthly things.”
“I have no greater joy than to hear that my children are walking in the truth.”
“Sanctify them by the truth; your word is truth.”

EXEMPLIFYING.text: “The righteous lead blameless lives; blessed are their children after them.”
“Follow my example, as I follow the example of Christ.”
Encourages leaders to care for their flock by being examples rather than domineering.

COMMUNICATING.text: “Be like-minded, be sympathetic, love one another, be compassionate and humble.”
“Be kind and compassionate to one another, forgiving each other...”
“Rejoice with those who rejoice; mourn with those who mourn.”
“As a father shows compassion to his children, so the LORD shows compassion to those who fear Him.”
“Everyone should be quick to listen, slow to speak and slow to become angry.”
“Fathers, do not embitter your children, or they will become discouraged.” (Reminds parents to be gentle and understanding.)

ENGAGING.text: “Everyone should be quick to listen, slow to speak and slow to become angry.”
“To answer before listening—that is folly and shame.”
“Let the little children come to me… for the kingdom of God belongs to such as these.” (Jesus paid attentive care to children.)
“Fathers, do not provoke your children to anger, but bring them up in the discipline and instruction of the Lord.” (Implies attentive guidance rather than neglect or harshness.)

AFFIRMING.text: “Do not let any unwholesome talk come out of your mouths, but only what is helpful for building others up…that it may benefit those who listen.”
“Therefore encourage one another and build each other up…”
“Gracious words are a honeycomb, sweet to the soul…”
At Jesus’ baptism, a voice said, “You are my beloved Son…”

LOVING.text: “Love the LORD your God with all your heart…”
“A new command I give you: Love one another…”
“…train the young women to love their husbands and children.”
“As a father has compassion on his children, so the Lord has compassion on those who fear Him.” (God’s model of fatherly love to emulate.)

TEACHING.text: “We will tell the next generation the praiseworthy deeds of the LORD, His power, and the wonders He has done.”
“These commandments... are to be on your hearts. Impress them on your children…”
“Start children off on the way they should go…”
Highlights that Scripture is useful for teaching, rebuking, correcting, and training in righteousness.

TRAINING.text: “No discipline seems pleasant at the time, but later it produces a harvest of righteousness and peace…”
“Whoever spares the rod hates their children, but the one who loves their children is careful to discipline them.”
“Fathers, do not exasperate your children; instead, bring them up in the training and instruction of the Lord.”
“Train up a child in the way he should go; even when he is old he will not depart from it.”

PEACEMAKING.text: “How good and pleasant it is when God’s people live together in unity!”
“Bear with each other and forgive one another... Forgive as the Lord forgave you.”

ENTRUSTING.text: “Trust in the LORD with all your heart and lean not on your own understanding…”
“Father, not my will, but yours be done.”
Encourages humility and putting others’ needs first.
